opinion.court: Supreme Court of the United States
opinion.case_name: Janice Bonner v. City of Indianapolis. Jacque Durham v. City of Indianapolis

opinion:
368 U.S. 350

82 S.Ct. 391

7 L.Ed.2d 384

Janice BONNER
v.
CITY OF INDIANAPOLIS. Jacque DURHAM v. CITY OF INDIANAPOLIS.

Nos. 546, 547.

Supreme Court of the United States

January 8, 1962

William C. Erbecker, for appellants.

Patrick J. Smith, for appellee.

PER CURIAM.

1

The motion to dismiss is granted and the appeals are dismissed. Treating the papers whereon the appeals were taken as petitions for writs of certiorari, certiorari is denied.
